sen.j: 紀 咋麻呂（き の くいまろ、天平勝宝7年（755年） - 天長10年1月19日 (旧暦)（833年2月12日））は、平安時代初期の官人。
sen.e: KI no Kuimaro (born in 755 and died on February 12, 833) was a government official in the early Heian period.

In May 799, he got the title.
He was conferred a peerage in May 799,.
sen.cmt: conferred a peerageの方が良いと思います。
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in May 799,.

sen.j: 延暦23年（804年）8月、桓武天皇の和泉国への行幸のとき御後副長官を勤める。
sen.e: In August 804, when the Emperor Kanmu went to Izumi no kuni (Izumi Province), he accompanied him as the deputy chief of gogo (a retinue of the Emperor).
In August 804, when Emperor Kanmu went to Izumi no kuni (Izumi Province), Kunimaro accompanied as the Deputy-Director of the imperial procession.
sen.cmt: 用語集を参考に単語を修正しました。heだと昨麻呂を指すのか、天皇を指すのか明確ではないため変更しました。Emperor ○○の場合theは不要です。
sen.e: In August 804, when Emperor Kanmu went to Izumi no kuni (Izumi Province), Kunimaro accompanied as the Deputy-Director of the imperial procession.

sen.j: また桓武天皇崩御の際には御装束司を勤めた。
sen.e: When the Emperor Kanmu died, he played an important roll as goshozokushi (a government official who handles important rituals).

sen.j: その後、中務少輔、刑部大輔、左京大夫、兵部大輔などを歴任した。
sen.e: After that, he took various positions such as Nakatsukasa no Shofu (the Junior Assistant Minister who deals with the Imperial Court affairs), Gyobu taifu (the Senior Assistant Minister of Administration of Justice), Sakyo no daifu (the chief of the Eastern Capital offices) and Hyobu taifu (the Senior Assistant Minister of Military Administration).

sen.j: 天長10年（833年）正月、79歳で卒去した。
sen.e: On January 1, 883, he died at the age of 79.
He died at the age of 79 on February 12, 833.
sen.cmt: 旧暦のままになっています。（B４のセル参照）
sen.e: He died at the age of 79 on February 12, 833.

sen.j: 最終官位は正四位下出雲守だった。
sen.e: His final official rank was Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade), Izumo no kami (Governor of Izumo Province).
He was the Shoshiinoge Izumo no kami (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade, Governor of Izumo Province).
